title: Do functional components behave like React.Component or React.PureComponent?
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
I'm not sure. :)

**What is the current behavior?**
The docs say that a functional component has the same behavior as [React.Component](https://reactjs.org/docs/react-component.html)
https://reactjs.org/docs/components-and-props.html#functional-and-class-components
shouldn't they have the same behavior as [React.PureComponent](https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactpurecomponent)?
 
**What is the expected behavior?**
I was under the impression that a functional component _already_ has the same behavior as [React.PureComponent](https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactpurecomponent), if that is the case, then the docs should be updated, if that is not the case then one of two things should happen:
- Functional components _should_ have the same behavior as [React.PureComponent](https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactpurecomponent)
- The docs should recommend using [React.PureComponent](https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactpurecomponent) instead of functional components since the performance would be better.

I suppose I do not understand how a functional component could **not** be _pure_, unless you were doing some sort of anti-pattern.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**
16+
